revised_title: Auditory Ossicles Evolution and Visceral Arches Modifications
tldr: The article discusses the evolutionary development of the first and second visceral arches, particularly focusing on the homologies of the auditory ossicles. It explains how these arches initially served for respiration and later became part of the alimentary system. The hyomandibula, originally a part of the suspension system, took on a new function in sound conduction and evolved into the stapes, malleus, and other auditory components. The study covers various species, from lower Selachians to higher mammals, and highlights the changes in the bones' structure and functions over time.
